articles.title: Consulting
articles.contents: I consult in data science, mainly around R and Python package development, record linkage, and entity resolution. Use the form below to contact me and learn more about my services:

articles.title: üëã Welcome!
articles.contents:
Github LinkedIn Email


üëã Welcome!
This website lists some of what I do. Check out my research, teaching, and software.
About me
I am a PhD Candidate in the Statistical Science Department at Duke University. I have a Mathematics B.Sc. and a Statistics M.Sc. from Universit√© du Qu√©bec √† Montr√©al. My research is currently supported by Professor Rebecca C. Steorts at Duke, by an Alexander-Graham-Bell Canada Graduate Scholarship, and by a doctoral award from the Fonds de Recherche du Qu√©bec - Nature et Technologies. I was awarded the Canada Governor General‚Äôs Academic Medal in 2020 for outstanding academic achievements during my M.Sc.
I have broad ranging interests in statistics. My M.Sc. research focused on theoretical properties of Bayesian nonparametric procedures. Recently, I have been working on more applied problems. I am particularly interested in issues surrounding inference with ‚Äúbig‚Äù administrative data, as well as using such data to better represent hidden populations in official statistics. This research involves privacy considerations, entity resolution for data integration and multiple systems estimation to account for missing data.
Throughout Spring 2022, I am working as a Data Scientist intern at the Intact Financial Corporation. I am part of the Rating Revolution team which develops machine learning models to improve the pricing of insurance products. 
In my free time, I like to get involved with other students at Duke. I am Research Coordinator for the Duke GPSG Community Pantry, helping improve our knowledge of food insecurity on campus. I have also worked with the Duke Applied Machine Learning Group and with the Data+ program as a project manager, and I have been a mentor for the Twoples directed reading program. I am very grateful for our international academic community and I try to give back as I can.
Sponsor me
Sponsor my open source work and community involvement through Github (USD):




or through Open Collective (CAD):




Hire me
I consult with small and medium-sized businesses on the topics of record linkage and deduplication, survey methods, data analysis, R/Python package development, and statistical learning. Learn more on my consulting page.

articles.title: Research
articles.contents:
Contents
Multiple systems estimation
Entity resolution
Bayesian nonparametrics
Side projects (posters)

Multiple systems estimation
Binette, O. and Steorts, R. C. (2021) On the Reliability of Multiple Systems Estimation for the Quantification of Modern Slavery. Journal of the Royal Statistical Society, Series A (to appear)
Binette, O. and Steorts, R. C. (2020) Discussion of read paper ‚ÄúMultiple-systems analysis for the quantification of modern slavery: classical and Bayesian approaches‚Äù by Bernard Silverman. Journal of the Royal Statistical Society Series A 183 (3). pp.¬†35 [link]
Entity resolution
Binette, O. and Steorts, R. C. (2021) Modern Bayesian Entity Resolution. Submitted
Binette, O. and Steorts, R. C. (2021) (Almost) All of Entity Resolution. arXiv e-prints. arxiv:2008.04443 [pdf]
Bayesian nonparametrics
Binette, O. and Pati, D. and Dunson, D. B. (2020) Bayesian Closed Surface Fitting Through Tensor Products. Journal of Machine Learning Research 21 (119) pp.¬†1-26 [pdf]
Binette, O. (2019). A Note on Reverse Pinsker Inequalities. IEEE Transactions on Information Theory 65 (7). pp.4094-4096. [pdf]
Binette, O. and Guillotte, S. (2019). Bayesian Nonparametrics for Directional Statistics. arXiv e-prints. arxiv:1807.00305. [pdf]
Side projects (posters)
Binette, O. (2018). Topology and Machine Learning. Notes from the Margin 13. pp.¬†5-6. [link]
Binette, O. and Luo, L. An Analysis of Gibbs Posterior Concentration in Terms of the Separation \(\alpha\)-Entropy. Objective Bayes Conference (poster presentation). Warwick (United Kingdom). June 28, 2019. [pdf]
Binette, O. and Coache, A. The Significance of the Adjusted R Squared. (Bio)Statistics Research Day (poster presentation). Montr√©al (Canada). September 21, 2018. [pdf]
Binette, O. Classification and Topology, or Consequences of Sobolev Consistency. Canadian Statistics Student Conference (poster presentation). Montr√©al (Canada). June 2, 2018. (Best poster award) [pdf]

articles.title: Software
articles.contents:
Python packages
StringCompare
StringCompare is a Python package (implemented in C++ through pybind11) for efficient string similarity computation and approximate string matching.

pip install git+https://github.com/OlivierBinette/stringcompare.git

GroupByRule
Deduplicate data using fuzzy and deterministic matching rules.

pip install git+https://github.com/OlivierBinette/groupbyrule.git

R packages
FingermatchR
Fingerprint matching tools based on NIST‚Äôs Biometric Image Software, on FingerJet minutiae extraction tool, and on the libfmr library.


devtools::install_github("forensic-science/fingermatchR")



MSETools
Code and analyses for the paper titled ‚ÄúOn the Reliability of Multiple Systems Estimation for the Quantification of Modern Slavery‚Äù (Binette and Steorts, 2021).


devtools::install_github("OlivierBinette/MSETools")



cache

Simple interface to caching which works across interactive R sessions, R scripts and Rmarkdown documents.


install.packages("assert")



assert

Lightweight validation tool for checking function arguments and data analysis scripts.


install.packages("assert")



dgaFast
Multiple Systems Estimation Using Decomposable Graphical Models. This is an efficient re-implementation and extension of the dga R package (it is now part of dga).


devtools::install_github("OlivierBinette/dgaFast")



TessTools
Tools for the use of Tesseract OCR in R and for the analysis of historical newspaper archives.


devtools::install_github("OlivierBinette/TessTools")



splinit
Periodic spline regression and closed curve reconstruction.


devtools::install_github("OlivierBinette/splinit")



pretty
Better baser plots in R.


devtools::install_github("OlivierBinette/pretty")



Javascript apps
Fractals
High resolution visualization for the Mandelbrot set. A Java version with more features is also available.
Earthquakes
Visualize earthquakes on the globe.
Other software
lipsample: Sampling from arbitrary Lipschitz continuous densities on the interval in matlab.

articles.title: Teaching
articles.contents:
TA at Duke University
Instructional TA (weekly labs and office hours) for the following classes:
STA 199 - Introduction to Data Science (Fall 2021)
STA 490/690 - Entity Resolution (Spring 2021)
STA 360 - Bayesian and Modern Statistics (Fall 2020) [teaching evaluation]
TA at Universit√© du Qu√©bec √† Montr√©al
Instructional TA (weekly labs and office hours) for the following classes:
STT 1000 - Statistics I (Winter 2019)
MAT 1130 - Analysis I (Winter 2019)
MAT 2710 - Probability II (Fall 2018)
MAT 2160 - Complex Analysis (Winter 2018)
MAT 1190 - Analysis and algebra for the actuarial sciences (Winter 2018)
MAT 2150 - Analysis II (Fall 2017 & Fall 2018)
Other teaching activities
Co-produced an activity for children at the Eureka! Science Festival (Montreal Science Center, June 2018)
